titleInfo.title: McKinley High School Oral History Project: History of the School
titleInfo.subTitle: Isabel M. Herson oral history interview, 1995

name.description: Isabel M. Herson was born in Baton Rouge, La., on September 23, 1910 to Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Morgan. She was part of the first class to graduate from McKinley High School after attending a full school year in 1928. She was a teacher and served as Chairman of the Department of Elementary Education at Southern University.

subject.topic: Southern University and A & M College.
African American high school students--Louisiana--Baton Rouge.

mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries Special Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special)
mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright is retained by Louisiana State University in accordance with U.S. copyright laws.

"E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments. See instructions for ordering reprints of this audio here: http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special/services/duplication.html Mention the ""Item number"" or ""Item URL"" in your request. "
mods.abstract: Herson describes herself as an honor student active in school clubs, academics, and athletics. She describes several classmates, faculty members, an average day, dress codes, codes of conduct, and McKinley High School's contribution to students, the community, and history of Baton Rouge. Herson describes her life experiences after leaving McKinley, reflects on the foundation she received there, and leaves words of wisdom for aspiring McKinley graduates.
